results.title: Friendship's Death
results.brief_description: In September 1970, a British war correspondent is distracted from his coverage of the conflict between Palestinians and Jordanians when he rescues a young lady from a PLO patrol. Named Friendship, she claims to be an extra terrestrial robot sent to Earth on a peace mission and accidentally diverted from her original destination, The Massachusetts Institute of Technology. Is she insane, a spy, or telling the truth? Wollen’s film comes across as a two-set Dr Who for adults, complete with political, philosophical and personal problems. Rated: M

results.title: Friends and neighbors = Friends and neighbours
results.creator_credit: Edmund Penney, Jack Wipper, Lori Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Investigates learning to live together, how to treat friends and neighbours, and shows how it is often easy to take advantage of the weak and gullible and to ignore social responsibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friends and Enemies
results.brief_description: This is a provocative film about one of the most vicious and protracted labour disputes in Australian history. In February 1985, over one thousand electrical workers went on strike against the introduction of contractors into the South East Queensland Electricity Board. Rated: PG

results.title: Friends
results.creator_credit: Peter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the concept of friendship. The story involves three girls - one, a possessive girl, another with an extroverted nature and the third who is seen by the first girl to threaten the friendship. The film is open-ended and relates to the social studies theme of “cultural influences”. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Friend or Foe (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An award-winning adaptation of the book by Michael Morpurgo, this is the story of two London boys evacuated to the British countryside during World War 11. Unaccustomed to the countryside, one boy falls into a fast flowing stream and is rescued by a stranded German pilot. Although the Germans are the enemy one has saved David’s life, so the boys, in turn, help the pilot and his wounded companion.

results.title: Friction
results.creator_credit: Dennis Ward, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Esso
results.brief_description: Part of the Advanced science series. Demonstrates the basic laws of friction: first, that friction is independent of surface area; and second, that it is proportional to load.

results.title: Fresh water: resources at risk
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: This documentary takes a look at some of the threats to North America’s water supply and at the actions people are taking to protect the quality and quantity of their freshwater resources. The video begins in the Great Lakes region, where students from Michigan and Ontario test for pollution in rivers that drain into Lake Erie. On the Great Plains, members of the Future Farmers of America are using more efficient irrigation techniques to conserve water stored in the Ogallala aquifer, and they’re sealing abandoned wells that can serve as a direct route for pollution to enter the aquifer. In the Southwest, water from the Colorado River supports agriculture, provides drinking water for city dwellers, and generates electricity - but dams and canals have altered the dynamics of the river. Scientists and students team up to study how the Glen Canyon Dam in Arizona has affected the balance of life in the Grand Canyon. The video wraps up in south Florida, where the increasing demand for water from agriculture and growing urban areas threatens life in the Everglades. In response to public service announcements and other educational efforts, Floridians are learning how they can help conserve their fresh water - tips that apply to people all around North America. Includes a brief teacher’s guide.

results.title: Freeze-in
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Albert Kish and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A film essay without commentary about the port of Montreal as winter closes in - the last-minute scurry as ships that can make it dash for open water, while those that cannot prepare for a long hold-over. On the docks all activity seems suspended as the numbing cold closes its grip. But there is activity on the iced-in ships and in the freight sheds, making ready for the time when the icebreakers open a river channel and traffic returns. Film without words.

results.title: Freestyle
results.creator_credit: David Lowe, Matt Morgan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The police investigating the murder of a young male swimmer interview a woman who regularly swims in the pool where he was murdered. Did she really not see anything?
